instructions.value: Peel and core your apples.
Blanch and immediately cool your tomatoes.
Once cool, peel and deseed the tomatoes.
Over medium heat, add oil and brown onions
Add all the other ingredients except the vinegar.
Simmer the mixture, continuing to stir and reduce until sauce-like.
Add the red wine vinegar and reduce a bit more
Blend the mixture using a hand mixer or a blender.
Optional: Pass through a fine sieve and bottle or jar.

description: Spicy and smokey Thai chili paste

instructions.value: Dry roast chilis, garlic and shallots in a pan.
Use a mortar and pestle to grind chilies and salt to a fine powder,
Continue griding while adding garlic, shallots, tamarind paste, and shrimp paste.
Add the paste to a pan with the oil and allow to heat up and fry for about 5 minutes.
Add the sugar, fish sauce, and water and simmer for about 5-10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Once the sauce is thin but slightly viscous, take off the heat and spoon into a clean jar.

title: Nam Prik Pao
author: WorldSauces

instructions.value: In a small pot, warm the sake and set fire to it with a match or grill lighter.
Once the flame subsides, pour the sake into a dish to cool
Mix grated daikon, chopped spring onions, soy sauce, lemon juice,and msg with the sake.

description: A basic donair sauce that goes great with salty meat.

instructions.value: Mix all the ingredients together.
Let sit overnight in the refridgerator.

title: Donair Sauce
author: WorldSauces

description: A paste that hits with a hard garlic punch.

instructions.value: Remove the germ from the center of each garlic clove.
Using a food processor, pulse the salt and garlic together until finely minced.
Add 2 tsps lemon juice and puree until a fluffy paste forms.
Very slowly drizzle 1/2 cup of oil, then a tsp of lemon juice.  Alternate until until lemon juice is gone.
Continue alternating 1/2 cup oil and ice water until water and oil are all used up.
Place in a sealed container and store in the refridgerator.

title: Toum
author: WorldSauces
